We offer options to customize the AI according to your needs. You can choose your preferred provider of large language models, or set an overall tone and style of answers by selecting the appropriate system message. Find more in the Settings tab.

A document can be uploaded within the chat, which the user then asks questions about. Similarly, it is possible to use a general chat, without involving an open document. The answers, which are based on the document in question, are provided with citations that allow for an easy checking of parts of the answer against the source text. Individual conversations are displayed in the plugin in the form of threads.

For actions you commonly use, create a simple shortcut to trigger the action. You can start filtering the action by typing '/' in the chat and then selecting the desired action from the list. You can use keyboard arrows to navigate through the list, and press Enter to select the action (this will send the prompt directly to the chat). Alternatively, you can scroll and select the action to paste its content into the input field, to further edit it.

For frequent, repetitive actions, you can also use the option to use AI directly from the opening screen. Several preset actions are offered by default. The answers are, in addition to the opening screen, also displayed in a separate thread in the Chat tab.
When selecting text in a file, AI can be used to suggest different variations of the text, taking into account the context of the file. See Editing tab for more information.

Coming soon Swap pairs of terms (e.g., "Company" –> "Buyers") over a document in a contextually-aware way. After selecting the pair or pairs, the plugin returns a list of suggested replacements, which can be individually accepted or rejected.
There are two types of user roles that any user can be given.

How to become Team Admin? There are 2 ways: Any user who creates subscription automatically becomes a Team Admin once an invoice is paid. Any user who is already Team Admin can assign this role to any other user who does not have Team Admin role yet.

Prerequisites: The user who attempts to add this role to another user already has Team Admin role. There are already users in at least one subscription of the company. Steps: Go to Settings > Users management Click on Your users From the list of users select the user and click on three dots in Actions column Select Make Team Admin

Subscription Cancel subscription paid by them. View all subscriptions in a company. View all users that belong to a subscription. Add user to a subscription. Remove user from a subscription. Roles Add Team Admin role to any other user who does not have the Team Admin role yet. Add Data Manager role to any other user who does not have the Data Manager role yet. Data Set/update/delete company secrets, e.g., DeepL API Key
How to become a Data Manager? Ask any user from your company who has the Team Admin role to give you the Data Manager role.

Prerequisites: The user who attempts to add this role to another user already has the Team Admin role. There are already users in at least one subscription of the company. Steps: Go to Settings > Users management Click on Your users From the list of users select the user and click on three dots in Actions column Select Make Data Manager
Data Set/update/delete company settings, e.g., system prompt Delete/Update smart snippet that is visible to all
Select a clause in the document and choose from a variety of editing options.
Under active development Search your internal knowledge base for relevant clauses and paste them directly into the document. Please see steps required to integrate SingleDraft with your documents.

When selecting text in a file, AI can be used to suggest different variations of the text, taking into account the context of the file. You can select and edit the suggested variations to apply several changes at once and then compare the result in tracked changes to the original text.
Translate text from one language to another using a variety of translation providers.
Save & paste commonly used signature blocks into the document. We offer several default templates to get you started, but you can also create your own and share them with your team.
To use the plugin securely, users must authenticate within the plugin. There are two methods of authentication:
This authentication flow requires the user to register with an email and password.

Click the Register button on the plugin login page. Fill in the email and password fields. A verification email will be sent to the user's email (check the spam folder if necessary). In the verification email, click the verification button. Once verified, the user can proceed to log in. Use the same email and password to log in.
For users who prefer to use enterprise Azure AD authentication.

Click the Login button on the plugin login page. Click the Microsoft Azure AD button. Log in with the Azure AD account. A prompt to approve the Single Draft application will appear. Approve it, or ask your IT admin to approve it, depending on the user's Azure AD settings. Once approved, the login process is complete. For subsequent logins, no further approval is needed.

Tracking of definitions is designed to enhance contract review by providing access to definitions and terms previously defined within the opened legal document. This feature saves you from having to search for definitions manually.

Quick Access: Selecting a term opens a dedicated card in the sidebar with its definition. From wherever you are in the document, you can quickly access the definition location by clicking on the "split window" icon (see video below). Nested Term Tracking: Terms within a definition that are also defined in the contract are tracked as well and further accessible from each definition card. Alerts: We check for consistency of defined terms and alert you on defined terms that are not subsequently used, duplicate definitions, or inconsistent use of the term throughout the document (such as defining a word with capital letter to then refer to it in lowercase). All individual alerts can be dismissed. Compare: For selected jurisdictions, we provide a feature to compare the definition with the legal thesaurus (such as Czech LegalVOC) to ensure the correct use of legal terms.

Open the document in MS Word and turn the plugin on by clicking on a corresponding icon in the upper row. Defined terms will be automatically recognized and displayed in the "cards" tab. To view a term's definition, perform one of the following: Select a term in the text to trigger the sidebar; or Navigate through the sidebar to select a term from a list of "cards" with defined terms; you can also use the search bar to find a specific term.

Once a term is selected, the plugin will display its definition within the sidebar. If the term contains nested definitions, they will be highlighted within the same card, and you can access them by clicking on the nested term. To access all mentions of a given term within the contract, click on the "Occurrences" tab inside the card. Declensions The plugin supports declensions of defined terms. For example, if the term "Contract" is defined, the plugin will also recognize "Contracts" as an occurrence of the defined term.
The plugin displays a number of specific alerts for legal writing. These alerts include include the types of alerts listed below.

In case of conflicting definitions (i.e., a single concept defined more than once), definitions that are drafted in a non-standard manner, or definitions that are not used in the document, the corresponding alert is then displayed in the definition card. In the 'Occurrences' tab, we also validate if all mentions of the defined term are consistently capitalized and that the defined term is being used before any other occurrences.
This alert verifies numerical consistency throughout the document. It activates when there are discrepancies between figures in numerical and written form.

The holiday alert checks the dates mentioned in the document against a database of public holidays and weekends. It notifies the user if a date coincides with a (future) holiday, which could have legal and practical implications.

The alert is triggered when the document contains a clause to be filled in, e.g., "The parties agree that the [insert date] is the date of the agreement." We check for common placeholders, highlighted text and other indicators of a template.

Unbalanced brackets can lead to confusion in interpreting the document's provisions. This alert detects any (mismatched parentheses)), braces, or square brackets to prevent potential misreadings of the contract's terms.
The standard number check verifies the format and structure of the numbers in the document. We check the validity of birth numbers, bank account numbers (including IBAN format) and others.

For each company listed in the document, the plugin checks whether the company name is mentioned close to the ID number. In addition, if a company ID mentioned that is not found in the corresponding public register, the plugin will display an alert. Supported for 🇨🇭,🇨🇿, 🇸🇰, 🇭🇷.
documents.s: Correctness of company names, company ID existence

documents.t: If a parcel is listed in the document, the plugin checks if the parcel is in the (Czech) land register and whether the correct parcel type is specified. Supported for 🇨🇿.
documents.s: Checking the existence and type of a parcel

documents.t: With respect to internal links to a certain part of the document, the plugin checks whether this link is created using Word's "Cross-reference" feature. Without using this feature, it may occur when if the document is edited and renumbered, a mismatch between the reference and the target location takes place.
SingleDraft checks whether the statute mentioned in the document is a valid statute in a given jurisdiction. If the statute is not valid, the plugin will display an alert. Supported for 🇨🇿
SingleDraft seamlessly connects with your SharePoint documents, enhancing your existing document management workflow. Here's how to set it up:

warning User doing this step must have Privileged Role Administrator role in their Azure Entra tenant. Navigate to our Consent initiation page Sign in to your SingleDraft account (or create one if you haven't already). You'll see an option to initiate the permission process. The consent is about you giving access to our application to read files and user groups in your SharePoint. Upon confirmation, you'll be directed to Microsoft's consent page where you can review and approve the requested permissions.

To enable document synchronization, please provide: Your SharePoint Site URL that contains folder(s) for synchronization, e.g., https://<your-domain>.sharepoint.com/sites/<name-of-your-site> Relative paths to folders that contains the documents for synchronization, e.g., templates/curated

SingleDraft manages access through SharePoint's existing group structure. The system: References the user group matching your SharePoint site name Grants access to users based on their email addresses within that group Maintains your existing permission hierarchy info If the group name is different from the Site name please let us know during onboarding. warning Please review this access model to ensure it aligns with your organization's security requirements.
Once configured, your documents will be available in the SingleDraft plugin within a few hours. The system will maintain ongoing synchronization to ensure your content stays current.

The external information feature enriches your legal documents by automatically integrating external data from various authoritative sources. This ensures that references to companies, statutory provisions, and case law within your documents are accurate and up-to-date.

When a company name is mentioned within a document, the feature cross-references this mention with data from Companies House and individual credit score databases in selected jurisdictions. We also allow you to search for a company in the Companies House by its name or ID number, via the 'Registers' tab. Supported for companies in 🇨🇭,🇨🇿, 🇸🇰, 🇭🇷.
This feature links mentions of statutory provisions directly to their corresponding texts. Users are able to access the exact wording of laws referenced within their documents. Supported in 🇨🇿.
For the parcels mentioned in the text, we display the available information from the Land Registry, checking their existence and the correct type of parcel in the text. Supported in 🇨🇿.

Coming soon Coming soon to selected jurisdictions. Let us know if you would like to see this feature supported for you. Similar to Statutory Information, this feature connects mentions of case law to the relevant legal precedents and judgments; with their full text accessible upon a single click.

Thank you for your interest in SingleDraft, the AI legal writing assistant integrated into MS Word. Our solution provides a layer of insights over a contract opened in MS Word: connecting information within the document (such as defined terms), connecting with external information (such as information from Company House), and providing suggestions on model clauses based on the internal database. SingleDraft is built with respect for your craft, leaving you in control of the document at all times and providing you with the insights you need to make the best decisions.
The plugin is available for both Windows and Mac platforms. For installation steps follow this link.
This page follows the official Microsoft installation guide.

Download “manifest” file (Click here to contact us to get the file) Have Microsoft Office 365 account Have one of these roles: Global Administrator Azure Application Administrator Exchange Administrator Management and deployment via Integrated Apps require that the users are using one of these: Microsoft 365 Business licenses (Business Basic, Business Standard, Business Premium) Office 365 Enterprise licenses (E1/E3/E5/F3) Microsoft 365 Enterprise licenses (E3/E5/F3) Full requirements in detail here

Go To Microsoft Office 365 - On the left sidebar click Admin icon. Go to Settings > Integrated apps. Click on Upload custom apps. Select App type = Office Add-in Upload manifest XML - Choose Upload manifest file from device, use the file provided above Click Next and Add users: - Keep the toggle for test deployment to No - Assign which users should be able to see and use the Add-in Finish deployment Click Next Accept permission request by clicking Next Click Finish deployment Go to Home tab in MS Word and click on Add-ins Sign in to MS Word Make sure to be signed in the MS Word with the account that is among the approved accounts that were assigned in previous step. Click on More Add-in The Add-in should be visible among other Admin Managed Add-ins Do not see the plugin at this point? Try refreshing the dialog
In case you run into an issue during installation please refer to this Troubleshooting guide.
There are currently two options to install the add-in into MS Word.
The plugin can be added into user's add-ins directly in the Word using Microsoft AppSource.
Go to Home tab in MS Word and click on Add-ins Click on More Add-ins Click on Store and in the search field search for Single Draft Click on Add button The Add-in is visible in My Add-Ins
In case you run into an issue during installation please refer to this Troubleshooting guide.

If you have Office 365 Business or Enterprise license this is an another option to install the add-in, allowing you to to install the add-in for multiple users at once. Click here to see installation steps

SingleDraft offers monthly and yearly subscription options, with invoices generated automatically at the end of each billing cycle. Each subscription is based on the number of seats your organisation requires. To purchase a subscription, you must have an existing SingleDraft account. During the subscription process, you'll specify the number of seats needed - this determines how many team users can be added to your subscription.

After completing your payment, you'll need to allocate seats to specific team users. If you have Team Admin privileges, please follow these steps at this link after the payment succeeded. IMPORTANT: Please note that the purchaser of the subscription is automatically added as a user to the subscription. Need assistance? Our support team is here to help ensure your team gets the most from SingleDraft.

If you cannot see Admin section in Microsoft 365 account it means you do not have sufficient rights. Please refer to this Microsoft webpage for full set of requirements for adding MS Add-in into Integrated Apps.
Only Business and Enterprise licenses support adding MS Add-in into Integrated Apps. Please refer to this Microsoft webpage for a full set of requirements for adding MS Add-in into Integrated Apps.
It can happen that your MS Word customization does not have Add-ins button at the Home tab of the MS Word.

When you have any MS Word document open, click on File This will open side bar, select Get Add-ins In case you do not see this icon either, please follow these steps: Click on File again At the bottom of the sidebar there is Options This will open new window Click on Customize Ribbon Add Add-ins to Home tab
